name: epilobium-hirsutum
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: Dehiscent hairy thin seed pods 1 to 3 inches long.  Seeds have white tufts of hair that aid in their dispersal by wind.
flower-description: The flowers are saucer shaped rose pink with white centers, resembling primrose blooms.  3/4" across, four petals with a notch at the top, four sepals, and eight stamens.  They appear at the top of the plant in leaf axils. Long seed pods split open to release many wind-dispersed seeds.
leaf-description: Mostly opposite densely hairy toothed lanceolate leaves with no petiole, they attach directly to the stem.  The leaves are deeply veined.
stem-description: Stems are erect, branched, very hairy.
